Breeding adult.description: In flight, note that Common Terns have more black in wings than Arctic Terns. Breeding adults have a longer bill that is tipped in black unlike the shorter and solidly red bill of Arctic Terns.

Nonbreeding adult.description: Nonbreeding adult Common Terns have darker wingtips and a longer bill than Arctic Terns.

Immature.description: Immature Common Terns can be separated from immature Arctic Terns by the more prominent black bar on the shoulder.

Juvenile.description: Juvenile Common Terns have a stronger shoulder or carpal bar than juvenile Arctic Terns. They also tend to have more brown on the back than juvenile Arctic Terns.

Breeding adult.description: Roseate Terns are much paler gray with longer tail streamers than Arctic Terns. They also lack the dark trailing edge of the wing that is visible on Arctic Terns in flight.

Juvenile.description: Juvenile Roseate Terns tend to be paler gray overall than juvenile Arctic Terns. They also have a slightly longer bill than Arctic Terns.

Nonbreeding adult.description: Forster's Terns have longer legs and a longer, thicker bill than Arctic Terns. Nonbreeding adult Forster's Terns have a dark eye patch, whereas the black on Arctic Terns extends behind the head.

Juvenile.description: Juvenile Forster's Terns have brown mottling on the back unlike juvenile Arctic Terns, which are more pale gray overall. Juvenile's also lack the Arctic Tern's black rear crown patch.
